alert.note: Alert for Sussex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 7:23PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN SUSSEX...NORTHERN WARREN AND NORTHEASTERN NORTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 723 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Newton to near Belvidere, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Hackettstown, Blairstown, Bangor, Franklin, Hamburg, Belvidere, Oxford, Hope, East Bangor, Branchville, Andover, Great Meadows-Vienna, Allamuchy-Panther Valley, Greendell, Five Points, Columbia, Crandon Lakes, Lake Mohawk and Portland. This includes Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 3 and 23. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
